sense.name: Put down by force or authority; come down on or keep down by unjust use of authority.
sense.commentary: Note: Use this sense for instances where an individual or group exercises authority over another individual or group.
sense.examples: The government suppressed the nascent uprising. Police suppress political activists.

sense.name: Reduce the incidence or severity of or stop; reduce, as in efficacy; control in expression.
sense.commentary: Note: Compare to sense 1. This sense does not involve an authority using force.
sense.examples: She suppressed her anger. The students suppressed yawns throughout the class. He suppressed the project. This drug can suppress the hemorrhage. Various cultural and economic forces have suppressed demand.

sense.name: Put out of one's consciousness.
sense.commentary: Note: Compare to senses 1 and 2. This sense does not involve stopping or reducing, and does not involve authorities exerting force.
sense.examples: He suppressed memories of his childhood. She suppressed thoughts of her newly married ex.
